file_content.text: You certainly showed those shaggy brutes who's boss.
You can occupy the factory now, Captain. The Wookiees won't bother anyone any more.
That's good news, I'll send troops in immediately.
This will provide a bit of comfort to my men. Good to see those hairy savages shown their place.
The Wookiees were a weed that needed pulling before it took root.
Rebellion must be crushed.
When word gets out, we'll see a lot less of things like this.
Your appreciation is welcome.
How could I not be? Thanks to you, Corellia will soon become a proud, important member of the Empire.
It's truly been a honor to meet you.
I won't always be available to clean up your failures, Captain.
Be thankful I was here.
We'll work harder to defend the glory of the Empire in the future.
Re-stocking, I hope? Word's spreading about those Wookiees; the longer they hold the factory, the worse it'll get.
Heal yourself up, Wexell. Don't worry, those savages will be punished.
My Lord, you honor a poor soldier with your presence, but you're a welcome sight about now.
I know you--General Hesker told me what you did against the Selonians. You couldn't have come at a better time.
Forgive my sentiment, sir, but it's a relief to have someone of your caliber and dedication here at last.
You've a right lethal look about you; that sort of attitude is handy right now.
It's the Wookiees--shaggy brutes tore into my men with a vengeance. Less than a third of us escaped, and most look worse than Wexell here.
We're a long way from Kashyyyk. What are Wookiees doing on Corellia?
I didn't expect Wookiees here.
Corellians like them as factory workers--they're supposedly industrious, clever with tools, and have strong backs.
It sounds like the Wookiees put your men through the grinder.
I'm sorry for your losses.
They're soldiers who performed honorably. Can't say the same for our foes.
They're only Wookiees, Captain--no match for Imperial troops.
How do you lose to animals?
In a proper fight we might have held, but the savages weren't much interested in one of those. We weren't expecting such resistance.
My men have been converting Corellian factories for the Empire's. No problems until we got to the magnogravitics plant.
The Wookiees in the plant refused to hand it over--they ambushed us, and now they're holding the factory. It's a bitter pill.
An example needs to be made of them.
I'll take care of your Wookiees.
It'll be dangerous. The Wookiees aren't interested in negotiation or reason.
The Wookiees won't attack.
You're right, but it's ultimately not the Wookiees that concern me. I'm more worried about what happens when word gets out.
Your failure has created an explosive situation.
Your incompetence is dangerous.
You think I'm not aware of what has happened, either with the Wookiees or my men?
Every hour they hold that factory, it inspires others into thinking they can defy the Empire.
I hate to say it, but we need a show of force to discourage this from happening again. Your capabilities are beyond ours.
The Wookiees will learn their strength is no match for my fury.
I will crush those savages.
They will learn the meaning of fear before the power of the Force.
I'll show them no mercy.
Am I being paid by the pelt, or for the job as a whole?
I'll handle your problem.
Central command manages the details of your reimbursement. The Wookiees will make you earn every credit.
Once word spreads, Corellia will learn the price of defiance.
I'll handle the Wookiees.
A Wookiee's a tough fight, even on equal footing--and they've all the advantages here.
They know every nook of that factory, and now they've had time to make ready.
If I get the chance, I'll go.
I'd hoped to see more enthusiasm from you, but I'll take what I can get.
The Wookiees won't go easier on you just because you're heart's not in it, so keep careful.
You're going into Corellia's own savage jungle. Hopefully we can raise a glass when it's all done.
[Refuse Quest] Not a chance.
I suppose not everyone lives up to their reputation.
That's the face of heroism in that tank--if he hadn't distracted them long enough for us to escape, we'd be dead.
